name: OXO Good Grips Swivel Vegetable Peeler
about_this_item: Swiveling twin blades with flexible action easily peel potatoes, apples and other tough skinned fruits and vegetables
Soft, oversized handle designed for repetitive strokes
Comfortable non slip grip, even when wet
Large hole in handle for easy storage

title: Excellent peeler!
content: I got this peeler to replace my 20 year old OXO peeler, which I love. I hate change and was not sure about the slightly different grip design.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I needn’t worry with OXO brand. This new peeler is amazing. The grip is very comfortable and it’s so nice having a sharp blade again. The blade rocks side to side more than my old one which makes cleaning much easier.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024

title: Very sharp !
content: I love the way it peels a potato or a carrot in record time — very sharp and gets the job done!  I highly recommend it!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The blade finally dulled after 30 years of use.  Thankfully, they didn't change anything about it--didn't need "fixing'".  Great product.  Handle is easy on the hands even for Thanksgiving loads of potatoes, short. end takes care of eyes.  Best peeler ever.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024

title: A replacement after 30 years!
content: Tired of struggling with stubborn produce? The OXO Good Grips Swivel Peeler is here to revolutionize your kitchen routine. With its sharp, swiveling blade, effortlessly glide through tough skins and say goodbye to peeling frustrations. This isn't just a peeler; it's a kitchen essential that delivers precision and speed.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I've used it on everything from potatoes and carrots to apples and cucumbers, and it handles them all with ease. This peeler is also a game-changer for quickly removing blemishes from produce like broccoli and greens. But that's not all - this versatile tool can also be used to create delicate shavings of lemongrass and ginger for added flavor in your dishes. I've even put this peeler to the test in a commercial kitchen setting, peeling hundreds of potatoes, yams, and sweet potatoes for our restaurant. It's incredibly durable, and the blade has held up exceptionally well. We've used over 20 of these peelers over the years, and they've consistently outperformed other brands.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024

title: Elevate Your Kitchen Game with OXO Good Grips Swivel Peeler!
content: A standout feature is its versatility. Beyond traditional peeling, I've found this peeler incredibly useful for tasks like peeling sugarcane. Its sharp blade effortlessly removes the outer layer, making it a valuable tool in our kitchen.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I had a Cutco brand peeler and apparently it either got thrown out or is somewhere other than it should be in my kitchen.  I was devastated.  I did not want to spend the money to replace it with another Cutco and started reviewing other peelers.  This one was rated high and the reviews were really good.  Most of the criticisms were that it was too sharp and some people got cut.  I had cut myself with my old one so that did not really scare me.  I am really glad that I purchased this brand.  It is just as wonderful as my old peeler and I highly, highly recommend this peeler to anyone who wants a quality peeler.  It peels like a dream!

title: quality
content: The play action on this peeler is super loose, and I love that.  The swivel is incredibly fast and the quality of this peeler stands out even with Zyliss next to it.  Is Zyliss better?  Probably.  And I'll tell you why...  The shape of a Zyliss is good, yes.  The price versus this and the swivel of the blade is stiffer, and the handle is medium compared to this which is large...  The blade is much sharper on the OXO.  Like it's going to cut you if you misuse it.  I like my Zyliss but when it's in the dishwasher I needed another one and this was cheaper...  huge handle, and OXO makes quality kitchen ware anyways.  OXO is right there with Zyliss on quality in my opinion. And the difference in cost, only time will tell which one wins but if you like a stiff peeler Zyliss.  If you like alot of action in the swivel, you have hands that can hold a larger tool, or you need a thinner slice maybe for fruits? OXO.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I purchased this in '21 in a pair, where the other one has the edge aligned perpedular to the handle. The perpendicular peeler is an awkward shape for me to use, but the straight edge one is the best & longest lasting I've ever had. After 3 yr of regular use, it isn't as sharp as it once was for a push motion. So I started using it to pull toward myself and I was amazed, for a second time, how sharp/durable the piece is. Today I bought 2 more.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
